monster.name: Nine-tailed Fey Fox

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The nine-tail's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 23}, +15 to hit with spell attacks). The nine-tails can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Pounce
entries: If the Fox moves at least 15 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a bite attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 24} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the Fox can make one extra bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Bite
entries: Melee Weapon Attack {@hit 17} to hit, reach 10ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 2d10 + 10}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 24} Strength saving throw or be {@condition grappled}. The nine-tails now has it in its jaws. It is the nine-tails choice to grapple the creature or not.

action.name: Tail Swipe
entries: Melee Weapon Attack {@hit 17} to hit, reach 15ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d8 + 10}) bludgeoning damage. The target of size large or smaller must succeed on a {@dc 24} Strength saving throw or be knocked back 20 ft and become {@condition prone}.

action.name: Shake Prey
entries: If the nine-tails has a creature {@condition grappled} of a size of large or smaller it can use a bonus action to take the creature in its jaws and vigorously shake it from side to side. The creature makes a {@dc 25} strength saving throw and takes ({@dice 2d12 + 10}) piercing and ({@dice 2d12 + 10}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: The nine-tails has advantage on Wisdom (perception) checks.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the nine-tails fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Superior Truesight
entries: They have Truesight out to a distance of 120ft. They can see through all illusions, even ones protected from Truesight, and can choose to dispel them instantly without a DC check as a bonus action.

trait.name: Immortal Fey
entries: The nine-tails is immortal. They cannot be aged. They heal double the hit dice on a short rest and a long rest only takes 4 hours. Over multiple long rests scars will fade, evidence of old wounds disappears and they can even replace lost body parts.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The nine-tails is an immortal, fey creature. They have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: True Illusion
entries: The Nine-Tails illusions are so potent they gain a physical and self sustaining form. Visual illusions cast through their Innate Spellcasting feature do not require the Nine-tails concentration. They can choose for the illusion to be immaterial or have physical substance. The True Illusion has one half the hit points, their to-hit is the Nine-tails spell attack and do one half the damage if applicable. Any spell or effect the illusion makes uses the foxfire cantrip.

trait.name: Foxfire Savant
entries: The foxfire a nine-tails can cast is legendary. Cast it as a 20th level sorcerer and double the range and flame volume of the cantrip. The Nine Tails can choose to cast it with either the Empowered or Quickened metamagic at will.

trait.name: Change Shape
entries: The nine-tails changes shape into its humanoid form. If the humanoid form is at zero hit points they cannot use this ability. The nine-tails must complete a long rest to bring it back to full hit points in both forms.

trait.name: Illusive Collapse
entries: If the nine-tails fox form is brought to zero hit points and its humanoid form is above zero hit points the nine-tails will immediately change shape by fading away in a waft of illusion. The nine-tails humanoid form

legendaryHeader: The nine-tails can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The nine-tails regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries: The nine-tails can cast their At Will spells with 1 action, their 5/day with 2 actions, or their 3/day with 3 actions.

legendary.name: Change Shape
entries: The nine-tails uses its Change Shape ability.

legendary.name: Tail Swipe
entries: The nine-tails makes a tail attack

legendary.name: Shake Prey
entries: The nine-tails shakes its prey.
